result.execSummary:
All charges against Blake Allen Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake Allen Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Allen Smith

records.addlTxt: 09:17 AM Defendant Blake Allen Smith in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Blake Allen Smith in custody.  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared appears by video by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.    Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  State recites agreement.  As part of the agreement, case is to be dismissed and read in.
Status conference on February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:54AM Defendant Blake Allen Smith in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Daniel James Chapman, appearing by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case (20CF307, 22CF36) and recites appearances.  

20CF307 -- Court reviews case.  Atty Chapman makes statement, indicates trial is still scheduled but has been in contact with State.  State makes statement, does not wish to make changes in cash bond.  Neither party has any substantive motions.  Court indicates case will proceed to jury trial, witness lists, jury instructions, and special verdict forms are due by 2/14/22.  

22CF36 -- Atty Chapman indicates he has not been appointed to case 22CF36 but would request it track with 20CF307.  Court indicates no bond will be set today in 22CF36 and it will track with 20CF307.  Status conference scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
